meanings.definition: Not conforming to the teachings or beliefs of Christianity.
meanings.sent1: Her actions were unchristian according to the church's rules.
meanings.sent2: The behavior of the group was unchristian and went against the teachings of their faith.
meanings.sent3: It was unchristian of him to eat the last cookie without offering to share.
meanings.sent4: The unchristian behavior of the politician shocked the community.
meanings.sent5: The unchristian act of lying left a stain on his reputation.

meanings.definition: Lacking qualities or characteristics typically associated with Christianity.
meanings.sent1: The unchristian behavior of the bullies was evident in their cruel actions.
meanings.sent2: The unchristian attitude of the boss made the employees feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: It seemed unchristian for the cat to steal the dog's bed.
meanings.sent4: The unchristian nature of the storm left destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The unchristian words spoken by the teacher hurt the students' feelings.
